definition: to let (sb do sth)/to allow/regardless of
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: "Labour won't stand by and let this continue, " David Cunliffe said.
sentences.chinese: 工黨不會坐視不管，任由這種情形持續。

sentences.english: Leave him to his foolish dreams.
sentences.chinese: 任由他去做愚蠢的夢好了。

sentences.english: We can't let the art of Cantonese opera wither away.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能任由粵劇藝術日漸凋零。

sentences.english: Letting deteriorating inter-Korean relations hinder the progress of the six-party talks must be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 一定要避免任由南北關係惡化妨礙六方會談進程。

sentences.english: However, you don’t want your friendships to hurt your performance or the performance ofyour friends.
sentences.chinese: 但又不願意任由這份友誼影響你或你朋友的工作。

sentences.english: Networking is one of the most powerful tools you have at your disposal.
sentences.chinese: 人際網是能任由你自己處理的最有力的工具之一。

sentences.english: On the way to the island, he would pull in the oars and just let the boat drift where it wished, for hours at a time.
sentences.chinese: 在去荒島的途中，他會撤了漿任由小舟隨波逐流。

sentences.english: Yang Zhiyuan besides nonofficeholding Ren Youya the tiger is bought outside have no alternative.
sentences.chinese: 楊致遠除了下臺任由雅虎被收購外別無選擇。

sentences.english: Lord, make me moldable in your hands;
sentences.chinese: 主啊，求禰使我可任由禰的手塑造。

sentences.english: She had her husband by the short hairs.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫完全任由她擺佈。

sentences.english: Let the whirlwind mourn its requiem.
Allowing anxiety to dominate our thoughts can result in stress and depression.
sentences.chinese: 任由焦慮控制我們的思想會使我們變的緊張和沮喪。

sentences.english: She abandoned her baby to fate.
sentences.chinese: 她讓自己的嬰兒任由命運擺佈。

sentences.english: Never resign yourself to letting fate run its course if it makes you unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要輕言放棄，任由天數左右你的喜怒哀愁。

sentences.english: They were lost at sea, at the mercy of the winds and waves.
sentences.chinese: 他們在海上迷失了方向，任由風浪擺佈。

sentences.english: He drooled tobacco juice over his chin.
sentences.chinese: 他任由菸草水滴淌到他的下巴。

definition: no matter what/despite/to allow (sb to act arbitrarily)
to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
let (one) have his way/as (one) pleases/at (one's) will
wantonly/recklessly/willfully
to appoint (sb to a post)
to arrange/to order about/to manipulate
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
absolutely unrestrained/unbridled/without the slightest scruple
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to slaughter/(fig.) to ride roughshod over/to take advantage of (others)
careless/reckless/casually/absent-mindedly/at will/at random/any old how
to stare blankly/to look on helplessly/to look on unfeelingly
to turn a blind eye to
to behave unscrupulously
to understand/to pay attention to/to take notice of
to not say a word
